Package model

Interface StockMarketModelInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MockModel, StockMarketModel
    public interface StockMarketModelInterface
    Interface that contains all the functions a stock market should implement.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getEvaluation

        float getEvaluation​(Investor currentUser,
                    java.lang.String portfolio,
                    java.lang.String date)
        Method to calculate evaluation of certain set of stocks on a particular date.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - A set containing all the stocks
        portfolio - name of the portfolio.
        date - Date where we want to evaluate.
        Returns:
        returns a float of evaluation of profit.

      • writeUpdatedUser

        void writeUpdatedUser​(Investor currentUser,
                      boolean newUser)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Method to update the user details to the database file.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - Details about the user passed as investor object.
        newUser - boolean that tells if the call is for newUser or existing
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when write fails, when writing new user or existing.

      • getPriceOnDate

        float getPriceOnDate​(java.lang.String stockName,
                     java.time.LocalDate date,
                     boolean now)
        methdod to get current price of particular stock on a date.
        Parameters:
        stockName - Stock name
        date - Date
        now - if true then we calculate for current time "RegularMarketPrice", else we take close price,
        Returns:
        closing price of stock on that date.

      • checkUserOrStock

        boolean checkUserOrStock​(java.lang.String name,
                         boolean userNameCheck)
        Helper method to check if the username is present in the list.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the stock or name to check.
        userNameCheck - boolean to mention if checking userName or stock
        Returns:
        true if the thing searching exists.

      • checkStockInPortfolio

        Stock checkStockInPortfolio​(Portfolio nPortfolio,
                            java.lang.String stockName)
        Method to check if entered stock exists in the portfolio of not.
        Parameters:
        nPortfolio - portfolio to chekc the stock.
        stockName - name of the stock to be checked.
        Returns:
        successful stock if exists, null if not.

      • loadFromExisting

        Investor loadFromExisting​(java.lang.String userName)
                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Load the userDetails if the user exists in database or create a new investor with userName passed.
        Parameters:
        userName - userName of the person logged in.
        Returns:
        Investor object of the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - : thrown if the user details database does not exist.

        Parameters:
        userName - : username with which we want to create profile.
        Returns:
        : returns the username.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - : Thrown when write exception happens in file.

      • portfolioExists

        boolean portfolioExists​(Investor currentUser,
                        java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Method to check if a given user contains a portfolio with a given name or not.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - User to check.
        portfolioName - portfolio name to check.
        Returns:
        true if it exists false if it does not.

      • checkPortfolioFlexible

        boolean checkPortfolioFlexible​(Investor currentUser,
                               java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Method to check if the portfolio is flexible or not.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - investor object.
        portfolioName - portfolioName.
        Returns:
        true if flexible else false.

      • addStockToPortfolio

        Portfolio addStockToPortfolio​(Portfolio portfolio,
                              java.lang.String stockName,
                              java.lang.String quantity,
                              java.lang.String date,
                              boolean create,
                              float broker)
        Method to add stocks to portfolio for a given user.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - InflexiblePortfolio to add the stock to
        stockName - name of the stock
        quantity - number of stocks
        date - date to buy the stock
        create - true if to add stock
        broker - broker fees charged
        Returns:
        added portfolio

        newPortfolio - portfolio to be added.
        Returns:

        portfolioName - name of the portfolio.
        Returns:
        returns the composition.

      • deleteStockFromPortfolio

        Portfolio deleteStockFromPortfolio​(Portfolio nPortfolio,
                                   java.lang.String stockName,
                                   java.lang.String quantity,
                                   java.lang.String sellDate,
                                   float brokerfees)
        Method to sell stocks from a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        nPortfolio - Portfolio from which we need to sell the stock.
        stockName - Name of the stock to sell.
        quantity - Number of stocks to sell.
        sellDate - Date on which we want to sell the stocks.
        brokerfees - broker fees.
        Returns:
        the updated portfolio after selling the stock.

                        java.lang.String portfolioName,

        Method to evaluate the cost basis of a given portfolio for a given user.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - Investor whose cost basis we want to calculate.
        portfolioName - portfolioName that we want to evaluate cost basis.
        dateToCheck - date to evaluate cost basis.
        Returns:
        the costbasis

        portfolioName - Portfolio name to check portfolio performance.
        dateInitial - first date.
        dateFinal - last date.
        Returns:
        the visualization
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IO exception while write.
